medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 36-year-old woman, sought treatment in 1977 due to fatigue and exercise intolerance. At catheterization, she was diagnosed with mixed aortic valve disease and moderate aortic regurgitation, with a peak transvalvular gradient of 50 mm Hg. Symptoms have been stable post-surgery, and no valve-related complications have occurred since.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of rheumatic fever complicated by rheumatic valve disease; mitral valve replacement with a mechanical prosthesis in 1996.
medical_history.social_history: Healthy, physically active, normal lipid profile, normotensive, and follows a balanced diet.
